H0.text: Who was famous for popularising the 'little black dress' in the 1920s. Paul Poiret

H1.text: Who was famous for popularising the 'little black dress' in the 1920s. Elsa Schiaparelli

H2.text: Who was famous for popularising the 'little black dress' in the 1920s. Madeleine Vionnet

H3.text: Who was famous for popularising the 'little black dress' in the 1920s. Coco Chanel

A4.text: In 1926, the American edition of Vogue published an image of a Chanel little black dress with long sleeves, dubbing it the gar√ßonne ('little boy' look).

A5.text: In 1920, Chanel herself vowed that, while observing an audience at the opera, she would dress all women in black.
